Overview  Package  Class   Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Uses of Package
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common

Packages that use de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.analyzer Interfaces required to receive and process the state of the simulation. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.application Interfaces specific to the application layer. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.churn Interfaces required to generate Churn, i.e. hosts going online and offline during the simulation. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common Defines interfaces and final object common for all layers and components. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.network Provides interfaces necessary to implement the network layer and all its subcomponents such as the used latency model or a specific subnet implementation. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.overlay Overlay specific interfaces. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.scenario Defines interfaces for the scenario and its factory. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.storage Documents and local storage for documents 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.transport Interfaces specific to the transport layer. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.email   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.email.solution   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.analyzer Provides analyzers used to measure the simulated components. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.application The clients of applications like napster can be found here. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.application.filesharing Provide implementations for the simulation core itself and components provided with it. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.application.filesharing.operations   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.churn Provides churn implementations. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.common Provides default implementations for hosts, properties and monitors. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.network Package where different network implementations are located. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.network.gnp   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.network.simple Implementation of the simple network, which does not rely on a topology. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay Different overlay implementation are located here. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.cd Provides overlays used to distributed content (i.e. documents) after they were found. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.cd.messages   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.cd.operations   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.dht Contain implementations of (structured) overlays which implement the Distributed Hash Table (DHT) API 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.dht.centralized A proof-of-concept example DHT implementation based on a central server. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.dht.centralized.messages   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.overlay.dht.centralized.operations   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.scenario Provides classes required to initialize the simulator run (i.e. scenario). 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.simengine Actual implementation of the PeerfactSim simulator engine. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.storage Provides implementations of local storages, which are used by hosts to store documents locally. 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.transport This layer encapsulates the details of the underlying network corresponding to layer four in the ISO/OSI model 
de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.util.helpers   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt.message   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.overlay.bt.operation   
de.tud.kom.p2psim.util   
uc3m.netcom.peerfactsim.impl.network.simple   
uc3m.netcom.peerfactsim.overlay.bt.operation   
 

Classes in de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common used by de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.analyzer
Host
          Host represents an end-system in a (p2p) network.
Operation
          This class realizes the command pattern for common operations in a distributed system.
 

Classes in de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common used by de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.application
Component
          Basic interface for all components of a host (=end node) in a distributed system.
OperationCallback
          Operation callback is used to inform the caller of an operation about operation's finish status.
SupportOperations
          Components implement this interface to receive the operation's result (mainly overlays and applications do this).
 

Classes in de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common used by de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.churn
Host
          Host represents an end-system in a (p2p) network.
 

Classes in de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common used by de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common
Component
          Basic interface for all components of a host (=end node) in a distributed system.
ComponentEvent
          Tagging (=marker) interface for all events thrown by components.
ComponentEventListener
          Tagging (=marker) interface for listeners which receive component events.
ConnectivityEvent
          Event which notifies that the connectivity of a host changed, i.e. that the host went online or offline.
ConnectivityListener
          A ConnectivityListener must be implemented to support notification that the connectivity of a host changed, i.e. that the host went online or offline.
Host
          Host represents an end-system in a (p2p) network.
HostProperties
          Provides Methods to get some cross-layer information about a host.
Message
          General message interface for all messages exchanged between inside of the same layer in the simulator.
Monitor.Reason
          Provides additional information why an action occurs at a specific component
Operation
          This class realizes the command pattern for common operations in a distributed system.
OperationCallback
          Operation callback is used to inform the caller of an operation about operation's finish status.
SupportOperations
          Components implement this interface to receive the operation's result (mainly overlays and applications do this).

          Host represents an end-system in a (p2p) network.
HostProperties
          Provides Methods to get some cross-layer information about a host.
Monitor
          Monitor defines a central instance which is called by components whenever an action occurs that is important to trace.
Monitor.Reason
          Provides additional information why an action occurs at a specific component
Operation
          This class realizes the command pattern for common operations in a distributed system.
OperationCallback
          Operation callback is used to inform the caller of an operation about operation's finish status.

          Components implement this interface to receive the operation's result (mainly overlays and applications do this).
